intro: Goniophlebium terrestre, commonly known as the terrestrial liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming moss-like plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil. The plant has a simple structure with leaf-like structures called phyllidia that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having structures that perform similar functions. Goniophlebium terrestre plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for other organisms.
